results.firPara: Ilkay Gündogan has warned his Manchester City team-mates to keep their feet on the ground after the defeat of Barcelona and make sure the group stage is safely negotiated before looking too far ahead.
results.secPara: The former Borussia Dortmund midfielder, scorer of two goals in Citys 3-1 victory at the Etihad Stadium on Tuesday, described the occasion as a very special night but one that was only part of a process. It was quite an impressive win for us, but just a win, Gündogan said.
results.webTitle: Manchester City beating Barcelona was ‘just a win’, says Ilkay Gündogan

results.firPara: Memphis Depay is fighting for his Manchester United future after being excluded from the squad for the Europa League match at Fenerbahce on Thursday and Dick Advocaat, the Turkish clubs manager and Depays first head coach, believes he may have to leave Old Trafford to further his career.
results.secPara: José Mourinho chose a 21-man squad for the trip to Istanbul yet despite the competition being a low priority, the manager could find no place for Depay.
results.webTitle: Memphis Depay’s Manchester United future in doubt after Fenerbahce exclusion

results.firPara: It was one of those nights when the Champions League music played loud and clear but no one danced to the tune. The entertainment on the pitch did nothing to warm the hearts of the supporters on a chilly night in the Danish capital as Leicester were made to wait for the chance to confirm their place in the last 16.
results.secPara: Claudio Ranieris side now need one point from their final two matches to guarantee being in the knockout stage and it would be a major surprise if that landmark moment failed to arrive at home against Club Brugge in a little under three weeks time.
results.webTitle: Leicester City step closer to qualification with draw in Copenhagen

results.firPara: When Charles Aránguiz struck for goal midway through the second half everything seemed to lapse into slow-motion. It was Tottenham Hotspurs misfortune the ball deflected first off Ben Davies and then off Kyle Walker to fall perfectly for Kevin Kampl. The Bayer Leverkusen midfielder took one touch before he swept it low past Hugo Lloris from close-range.
results.secPara: This was no streaky Leverkusen success. They had a plan to stifle Tottenham which they executed to perfection and it was the Bundesliga team who had the best of the limited crop of chances. Not for the first time in recent weeks Tottenham failed to click in an attacking sense and it was difficult to remember Bernd Leno being truly extended in the Leverkusen goal.
results.webTitle: Bayer Leverkusen’s Kevin Kampl takes advantage of out-of-sorts Tottenham

results.firPara: Tottenham were lucky to lose by a solitary goal after an uncharacteristically awful, weird performance at Wembley
results.webTitle: Tottenham Hotspur 0-1 Bayer Leverkusen: Champions League – as it happened

results.firPara: Leicester inched closer to qualification for the last 16 after holding the Danish champions to a goalless draw
results.webTitle: FC Copenhagen v Leicester City: Champions League – as it happened

results.firPara: The ninth W-League campaign sees a record arrival of foreign players, and with unexpected destinations for some of them, this season is far from a fait accompli
results.secPara: In the history of the W-League there has never been such a flagrant display of dominance as Melbourne Citys dramatic entrance last season.
results.webTitle: W-League 2016-17 preview: overseas armada sees women’s game rise to new level | Richard Parkin

results.firPara: José Mourinho has accepted two Football Association charges of misconduct and will serve a one-match touchline ban and be fined £58,000.
results.secPara: Mourinho was charged with verbally abusing the referee, Mark Clattenburg, during the goalless draw with Burnley, as the teams emerged for the second half at Old Trafford on Saturday.
results.webTitle: José Mourinho accepts two FA charges and is handed one-match ban

results.firPara: José Mourinho says his decision to recall Bastian Schweinsteiger to Manchester United first-team training was made to prepare him should the player decide to leave. Schweinsteiger has been excluded from Mourinhos senior group since the Portuguese took over as manager in the summer. To some surprise the midfielder rejoined the squad on Monday.
results.secPara: The 32-year-old former Germany captain has previously stated he would not play for another European club yet Mourinho indicated Schweinsteiger may still leave. While this might be for a Major League Soccer team or one in China or Asia, the manager said Schweinsteiger is back. Looking at Bastian and the way he is working professionally every day with the fitness coach we think its a human decision, a professional decision, to bring him back to the team.
results.webTitle: Bastian Schweinsteiger back in training to prepare for exit, says José Mourinho

results.firPara: In todays Fiver Hans Christian Andersen, poor ol Danny Ings, Tonton Zola Moukoko and good news! Henrikh Mkhitaryan has been found!
results.secPara: In todays Fiver Hans Christian Andersen, poor ol Danny Ings, Tonton Zola Moukoko and good news! Henrikh Mkhitaryan has been found!
results.webTitle: Taking the field in equally fantastical garb
